description_html:
This is your Project Draft area ‚Äî a private space inside the project where you can experiment, outline ideas, or prepare content before sharing it on the public Project Page.

It‚Äôs visible only to you (and collaborators you explicitly share with).

‚úç Current Work in Progress

üí¨ Use this section to jot down raw ideas, rough notes, or specs that aren‚Äôt ready yet.

  • Outline project summary and goals

  • Draft new feature spec

  • Review dependency list

  • Collect team feedback for next iteration

‚úÖ Tip: Turn these items into actionable issues when finalized.

üß± Prototype Commands (if technical)

You can also use code blocks to store snippets, scripts, or notes:

# Rebuild Docker containers
docker compose build backend frontend

description_html:
Welcome to your Private Pages section.
This area is only visible to you (and anyone you share it with).
Use it for drafts, personal notes, meeting summaries, or experiments before publishing them to the shared Wiki.

üß≠ What Goes Here

Use Private Pages for:

  • üß† Drafts or work-in-progress documents

  • üóì Personal planning or goal tracking

  • üßæ Meeting or 1-on-1 notes

  • üí¨ Manager or team-lead documentation

  • üîê Sensitive information (strategy, performance, salary bands, etc.)

üí° Tip: Move or publish a private page once it‚Äôs ready for the broader team.

‚úç My Current Focus

Priority

Task

Status

Due

üî¥ High

Finish quarterly roadmap draft

‚è≥ In progress

Oct 15

üü° Medium

Prepare design feedback summary

‚úÖ Done

Oct 5

üü¢ Low

Write knowledge-sharing doc

‚è≥ In progress

‚Äî

üß© You can turn any table into a personal tracker for your goals or initiatives.

üß† Ideas in Progress

ü™∂ Toggle open each section as you brainstorm or outline ideas.

üí° Product Experiments- ‚ÄúSmart Filters‚Äù for project views - ‚ÄúAutomated status updates‚Äù using AI triggers - ‚ÄúWorkspace themes‚Äù for better personalization üß≠ Process Improvements- Simplify cycle planning meetings - Introduce async demos every Friday

‚úÖ Personal Checklist

  • Draft next week‚Äôs release summary

  • Review product analytics

  • Update team OKRs

  • Schedule 1-on-1s

  • Write weekly reflection note

üß© This shows how to use checklists inside your private docs.

üìé References & Links

You can embed or link things only you see here:

  • Plane Projects View

  • GitHub Issue Tracker

üìé Paste URLs directly to turn them into embeds or previews.

üß© Using Blocks Creatively

  • Use callouts for insights:

    üß† Observation: Weekly triage reduced backlog by 20%.

  • Use quotes for inspiration:

    ‚ÄúThe secret of getting ahead is getting started.‚Äù ‚Äî Mark Twain

  • Use code blocks for notes or commands:

    docker compose up -d

ü™Ñ Tips for Private Pages

  1. Experiment here freely ‚Äî no one sees it until you share it.

  2. Test different block types (tables, checklists, embeds, callouts).

  3. Use it as your personal scratchpad ‚Äî everything autosaves.

  4. Convert a private page to public when ready to collaborate.

  5. Create sub-pages for recurring tasks or learning logs.

üîê Private Pages = your sandbox
Explore, iterate, and organize your thoughts before publishing to the company Wiki.

‚ú® Ready to try?
Create a new page in this section and experiment with:

  • A personal journal

  • A roadmap draft

  • A learning notebook

  • A meeting recap

This is your private workspace inside Plane ‚Äî make it truly yours.

description_html:
This is your Wiki Home ‚Äî the heart of your workspace where knowledge, documents, and processes live.

Use this page to document your company, your projects, and your people.

Each section below shows how you can use different block types to organize content beautifully.

üè¢ About Your Company

üåç Mission & Vision

"Every great company starts with a clear why."

‚úè Edit this block to describe your mission.
Example: "Our mission is to simplify how teams plan, collaborate, and deliver work ‚Äî together."

üíé Core Values

Use bullet lists to describe your culture and principles:

  • Transparency builds trust.

  • Simplicity scales.

  • Progress over perfection.

  • Community drives innovation.

üß≠ Getting Started

‚úÖ Quick Checklist for New Joiners

  • Read the company overview.

  • Meet your team members.

  • Set up your development or work environment.

  • Explore Plane's Changelog and learn more

  • You can turn any list into a checklist block for onboarding or task tracking.

‚öô How We Work

Team

Core Focus

Tools Used

Product

Planning & Prioritization

Plane Projects

Engineering

Building & Shipping

GitHub, CI/CD integrated with GitHub

Design

Craft & Consistency

Figma, Plane Docs

Marketing

Growth & Outreach

HubSpot

üß© This table shows how to present structured data inside your Wiki.

üõ† Product & Engineering

üß± Tech Stack Overview

Use headings and code blocks for documenting tech details

Frontend: React + Vite + Base UI
Backend: Django + Postgres + Redis + Golang
Queue: RabbitMQ
Infra: Docker + Kubernetes

üîó Linking Pages

Link other Wiki pages, Projects, or Modules directly:

  • Engineering Guidelines

  • Design System

  • Release Notes

This helps your Wiki become contextually connected to your workspace.

üé® Brand & Design System

üé® Color Palette

You can use color callouts to represent design tokens:

üü¶ Primary: Magic Blue (#3468FE)

üü® Accent: Sunlight Gold (#FAD54A)

‚ö´ Neutral: Space Gray (#22272E)

üß© Components Library

Use embeds to link to design assets, Figma files, or documentation.

üß© Tips for Writing Great Wiki Pages

  1. Start with a clear title ‚Äî it‚Äôs your page‚Äôs headline.

  2. Use headings (H2/H3) to structure your content.

  3. Add callouts for highlights or notes.

  4. Use tables for structured data and comparisons.

  5. Embed Plane views or media for context.

  6. Keep it short, searchable, and linked.

‚ú® Customize Your Wiki

Use this home as your playground ‚Äî experiment with:

  • üß± Block types (text, table, checklist, callout)

  • üîó Page links and embeds

  • üß† Hierarchies (nested pages)

  • üé® Themes and icons

ü™Ñ Pro Tip: Wikis work best when they evolve.

Encourage everyone to contribute, refine, and document what they learn.
